analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased across the UK over the last four years. The -8.2% change compared to a change of 4.3% in all GCSE entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in art and design subjects in 2017 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 75.6% of pupils achieved grade C/4 or higher in art and design subjects compared to 66.3% for all subjects.

Entries in additional science have increased across the UK over the last four years. The 16.2% change compared to a change of 4.3% in all GCSE entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved good passes in additional science in 2017 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 58.2% of pupils achieved grade C/4 or higher in additional science compared to 66.3% for all subjects.

Entries in further additional science have decreased sharply across the UK over the last three years. The -37.6% change compared to a change of 3.1% in all GCSE entries over the last three years.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in further additional science in 2017 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 75.2% of pupils achieved grade C/4 or higher in further additional science compared to 66.3% for all subjects.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in biology in 2017 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 90.4% of pupils achieved grade C/4 or higher in biology compared to 66.3% for all subjects.
